title: Three more suspects arrested in ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder
byline: The Colombo Crime Division (CCD) has arrested three additional suspects for aiding and abetting the assassination of notorious underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararatne, alias “Ganemulla Sanjeewa.”

title: Rainy weather to enhance in parts of the island from tomorrow
byline: The Meteorology Department says the rainy weather condition is expected to enhance over Northern, North-central, Eastern, Uva, and Central provinces and in Hambantota district for the next few days from February 24.

title: Another suspect arrested in connection with Middeniya triple murder
byline: Another suspect was arrested last evening (22) in the Thelambuyaya area of the Weeraketiya Police Division in connection with the recent triple murder in Middeniya, police said.

title: Israel delays release of Palestinian prisoners, citing ‘humiliating’ handovers of hostages
byline: Israel says the release of hundreds of Palestinian prisoners is delayed “until the release of the next hostages has been assured, and without the humiliating ceremonies” at handovers of Israeli captives in Gaza.

title: Over 120 live rounds of ammunition found inside bus in Bandarawela
byline: Police have seized 123 live rounds of ammunition from a bag found in the overhead rack where passengers place their bags.

title: Woman arrested with two firearms, ammunition, and swords in Habaraduwa
byline: A female suspect has been arrested with two revolver-type firearms, ammunition, and two swords found inside a house.

title: Pope remains in ‘critical’ condition after ‘respiratory crisis’
byline: Pope Francis’s condition continues to be “critical” after suffering a “prolonged asthma-like respiratory crisis” earlier on Saturday, the Vatican has said.

title: Navy arrests 32 Indian fishermen, five boats seized
byline: The Sri Lankan Navy has arrested 32 fishermen from Rameswaram in Tamil Nadu for allegedly crossing the International Maritime Boundary Line (IMBL) and fishing in Sri Lankan waters.

title: No threat to national security - President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today assured that there is no threat to the country’s national security.

title: NPP MP hits out at Deputy Minister’s comments toward female opposition MP
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) MP Dr. Kaushalya Ariyaratne has expressed her strong objection regarding the ‘unparliamentary’ language used by Deputy Minister Nalin Hewage towards Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Rohini Kaviratne in Parliament yesterday.

title: Govt to implement key measures to revitalize Sri Lanka’s tea industry
byline: Minister of Plantation and Community Infrastructure, Samantha Vidyarathna, stated that a considerable financial allocation has been made for the development of the tea industry in 2025.

title: Higher education for children with special needs to be prioritized - PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has emphasized that special attention will be given to the higher education of children with special needs under the supervision of the Ministry of Education.

title: 24-hour detention order obtained on 3 suspects in ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder
byline: The three suspects arrested by the Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) yesterday (22) in connection with the killing of notorious underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararatne, alias ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa,’ have been produced before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today.

title: Germans start voting, polls suggest shift to right
byline: Germans were voting in a national election on Sunday that is expected to restore power to Friedrich Merz’s conservatives while the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) party is forecast to achieve its best result yet in Europe’s ailing economic powerhouse.

title: No decision taken yet on police protection for MPs – Public Security Minister
byline: Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala says that the government has not yet made a decision regarding assigning police personnel to provide security to Members of Parliament (MPs).

title: Special exposition of Sacred Tooth Relic after Sinhala and Tamil New Year
byline: President Anura Kumara Disanayake announced that a special exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic will be held for the general public after the Sinhala and Tamil New Year.

title: Warm weather advisory issued for several provinces, districts
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued a Warm weather Advisory for tomorrow (24) in several provinces and districts in the country.

title: Sri Lanka govt approval rating soars to 62% in February 2025 – survey
byline: The government’s approval rating rose sharply after the election, from 24% in July 2024 to 62% in February 2025, when the latest round of the Gallup style ‘Mood of the Nation’ poll was conducted by Verité Research.

title: Shopping mall roof collapse in Peru leaves 6 dead, 78 injured
byline: The collapse of a food court roof at a shopping mall in northwestern Peru killed six people and left at least 78 others injured, the defense minister said Saturday.
